Key Match Events: Imad Wasim c â€ Pant b Arshdeep Singh 15 (23b 1x4 0x6 40m) SR: 65.21
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan's poor start in the USA means there's plenty of cricketing context to this game
India appear stable. Pakistan not so much.
Rohit Sharma's men aren't facing that sort of heat, having beaten Ireland in their first game.
India are likely to play the same XI that beat Ireland by eight wickets with 46 balls to spare.
Imad Wasim did not play Pakistan's game against USA due to a rib-cage injury, but head coach Gary Kirsten said he is fit and will play against India.
Azam Khan, who made a golden duck in Dallas, could get dropped.

Babar Azam had a shocker against USA: 4 off 14 balls in the powerplay, 24 balls before his first boundary, and dismissed for 44 off 43 just when Pakistan desperately needed him to continue the momentum he had only recently wrested.
India picked Shivam Dube in the XI primarily as a left-hand disruptor of spin in the middle overs.
Virat Kohli has been consistent in his last four T20Is against Pakistan, while for Babar Azam it's been all or nothing in their last two meetings in the shortest format
Post-Match Reflections: India won the match by 6 runs
Miscellaneous Highlights: The weather in New York was sunny on the eve of the match, but some weather websites have forecast showers for Sunday morning.
Fast bowlers have dominated the games so far in New York.
In the first four T20 World Cup matches played in New York, fast bowlers have taken 45 wickets and spinners only 10.
Teams have bowled 115.2 overs of pace, and only 27.2 overs of spin at this venue.
Others: The ICC are hoping the 34,000-seater stadium it spent millions to speed-build in the span of five months will be at full capacity, to show America the spectacle cricket can be in its most fever-pitched form.
